#Text=CanadaVOTES : CHP candidate Stefan Jetchick in Louis-Hébert
#Text=Friday , October 10 , 2008

#Text=In an attempt to speak with as many candidates as possible during the 2008 Canadian federal election , Wikinews has talked via email with Stefan Jetchick , who is a candidate in Quebec ' s Louis-Hébert riding , running under the Christian Heritage Party of Canada ( CHP ) banner .
#Text=The CHP is a minor , registered political party running a significant number of candidates across the country , looking to earn its first ever seat in the House of Commons .
#Text=Jetchick is their only candidate running in the province .
#Text=The Quebec riding of Louis-Hébert , in the Capitale-Nationale region , has existed in the House of Commons since 2004 .
#Text=It includes the west section of Quebec City , primarily Sainte-Foy — Sillery and Laurentien 's south end .

#Text=The Conservative incumbent in the riding is Luc Harvey ; also running are Pascal-Pierre Paillé ( Bloc Québécois ) , Denis Blanchette ( New Democratic Party ) , Jean Beaupré ( Liberal Party of Canada ) , and Michelle Fontaine ( Green Party of Canada ) .
#Text=The following is an interview with Mr. Jetchick , conducted via email .

#Text=The interview is published unedited , as sent to Wikinews ; this includes Mr. Jetchick 's separation of multipart questions into fragments , and his formatting relating to his applicable experience .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why are you running for political office ?
#Text=To try to educate voters about one of the most important problems in Canada as we speak .
#Text=( Sorry , this is going to be a big long . )
#Text=A good political party must propose the best solutions to the worst problems .
#Text=But , what is currently the worst problem in Canada ?
#Text=To find out , we must think about the nature of all societies .
#Text=What is one of the corner stones of a civilized society ?
#Text=Human rights !
#Text=Think about it : What 's the use of having well-paved roads , without potholes , if the police can arrest you for no reason ?
#Text=What 's the use of eliminating waiting lines in hospital emergency wards , if your neighbors can kidnap your children and steal your car ?
#Text=What 's the use of eliminating greenhouse gases , if you have no rights ?
#Text=Now , given human rights are fundamental , which is the most fundamental human right ?
#Text=The right to life , of course ! What 's the use of having the right to three warm meals a day , if anybody can kill you anytime ?
#Text=What 's the use of having the right to a decent minimum wage , if you 're dead ?
#Text=But currently in Canada , anybody can kill any pre-born child for any reason , from conception to childbirth .
#Text=That is our worst problem : we live in a barbaric country where the right to life is violated .
#Text=Why at the federal level ?
#Text=Ideally , I would run at both the Federal and Provincial levels .
#Text=Why this party ?
#Text=See answer to " Why are you running for political office " here above , and add to that the CHP is the only pro-life party in Canada .
#Text=And why in this riding ?
#Text=Lived here most of my life .
#Text=Previous to this campaign , have you been politically involved ?
#Text=Very little .
#Text=Ran for the same party , same riding , in 2006 .
#Text=How will you apply your previous work/volunteer/life experience to serving your constituents ?
#Text=Experience -- -> Effect on my political career
#Text=Canadian Armed Forces -- -> Never back down when intimidated
#Text=C++ Programmer -- -> Keep citizens informed with my squeeky-clean HTML
#Text=BA in Philosophy -- -> Drill down into root cause of problems
#Text=Conference interpreter -- -> Communicate well in English/French
#Text=As you campaign around your riding , it 's likely that some issues are mentioned more often by voters , than other issues .
#Text=What would you say are the three hottest topics this election , in your riding ?
#Text=Actually , I prefer forechecking to backchecking , so I 'm trying to control the agenda in my riding .
#Text=Hence my Challenge issued to all candidates .
#Text=What would you and your party do to address these issues ?
#Text=Protect innocent human lives from conception to natural death .
#Text=Are there any misconceptions about you , your leader , or your party and platform ?
#Text=Are there any ?
#Text=A whole truckload !
#Text=See FAQ for Louis-Hébert for a sampling of the most popular .
#Text=There are more ways than ever to get your message out , from the traditional campaign fliers and lawn signs , to new media like websites , Facebook , and YouTube .
#Text=The tried-and-true routes get the message out to the masses much easier , but digital alternatives are much more measurable in how many are seeing or interacting with your campaign .
#Text=What seems to be the most effective , from your experience ?
#Text=To answer that question , I like the old joke about the business owner who said : " 50 % of my marketing budget is wasted .
